]]> By: Joseph Miller http://werblog.com/2011/07/the-next-network-policy-battle/#comment-376 Mon, 18 Jul 2011 17:16:45 +0000 http://werblog.com/?p=2211#comment-376 I’m always left puzzled by the fact that network policy and social policy are still very much addressed in silos, even though on the surface everyone argues that progressive network policies are designed to promote those ends. If network policy is genuinely going to pursue societal ends, an ability to empathize with the poverty mindset seems to be at least as important as the technical issues.

The pursuit of happiness is at the core of American notions of independence. But happiness itself can seem unattainable if we perpetuate objective prerequisites. This causes people in the most dire conditions to stop striving, when the likelihood of achieving those prerequisites is statistically impossible.
